column1:
Even if you don’t use Tibetan Digits or Greek Numerals, it’s important to include local translations of these systems. Imagine a tech incubator in your city building a smartphone app for a global audience. When users choose number formats, every option should appear clearly in your language—just like they do in English or French. This shows professionalism, helps with accessibility, and prepares local developers to build inclusive, world-class apps that serve users from all cultures and language backgrounds.
Même si vous n’utilisez pas les chiffres tibétains ou les numéraux grecs, il est important d’inclure les traductions locales de ces systèmes. Imaginez un incubateur technologique de votre ville développant une application mobile destinée à un public mondial. Il devrait faire en sorte que, lorsque les utilisateurs choisissent les formats numériques, toutes les options apparaissent clairement dans leur langue — tout comme c'est le cas en anglais ou en français. Non seulement c'est faire preuve de professionnalisme, mais aussi, ça favorise l’accessibilité et prépare les développeurs locaux à créer des applications inclusives d'envergure mondiale qui serviront les utilisateurs de toutes les cultures et langues.

column5: Translator Notes/Comments
Digits/Numbers/Numerals in ABRON can all be referred to as "numɛse" which translates to Numbers in English.

column4: Roman Numɛse a ɛwɔ atwedeɛ nketewa mu
China Sikasɛm mu Numɛse a Yɛtwa so Tia
China Numɛse a Yɛtwa so Tia
Greek Numɛse a ɛwɔ atwedeɛ nketewa mu

column1:
In English, one way to write out the four-digit number 1000 is "1 thousand." A way to write 1500 is "1.5 thousand". Please provide translations of the following six abbreviations.
En anglais, une façon d’écrire le nombre à quatre chiffres 1000 est « 1 thousand ». Une manière d’écrire 1500 est « 1.5 thousand ». Veuillez fournir les traductions des six abréviations suivantes.

column5: Translator Notes/Comments
Apem stands for thousand singular
Mpem stands for thousands plural
In ABRON,  "Ɔpepem" means millions and when it reaches different levels of millions, another "pe" is added.
So here since we are talking in billions, another "pe" was added to the "Ɔpepem" to makea "Ɔpepepem".
And so it goes on, the more the level of million increases the more "pe" is added.

column1:
In English, one way to write out the four-digit amount $1,000 is "$1K." A way to write $1,500 is "$1.5K". Please provide translations of the following abbreviations, making sure also to use the correct currency symbol in your language. If your currency symbol comes before the number, place it before the number. If your currency symbol normally comes after the number, place it after the number. 
En anglais, une façon d’écrire le montant (à quatre chiffres) de 1000 dollars est « $1K ». Une façon d’écrire 1 500 dollars est « $1.5K ». Veuillez fournir les traductions de ces abréviations, en veillant à utiliser le symbole monétaire correct de votre langue. Si dans votre langue le symbole monétaire précède le nombre, placez-le avant. S’il vient après, placez-le après.

column5: Translator Notes/Comments
There are no nationality standardised abbreviations for this section. What is provided here may be the first of a kind as far as the entire Akan language is concerned:
Apem means thousand so we use the first letter to represent it.
Ɔpepem means million so we use the first letter to represent it.
In billions, we represent it with "ƆP" since the First "Ɔ" stands for millions.
With trillions, another "P" is added to "ƆP" to represent that.

column5: Translator Notes/Comments
There are no nationality standardised abbreviations for this section. What is provided here may be the first of a kind as far as the entire Akan language is concerned:
Translator Notes/Comments
Under this section, you will see names like North as (Atifi), East as (Apueɛ), South as (Anaafoɔ ), and West as (Atɔeɛ). Also Central as (Mfimfini ).
With standard, there isn't a specific word for it in time naming, you can decide to leave it like that or find a word which relates to it just like what I did by using "Ankasa".
Some cities/town names cannot be changed so it is kept the same - which is the case for many of these.

column5: Translator Notes/Comments

"Nkabom" means united but we add "kuo" because it is an organisation. 
"Kuo" can be group, organisation or party(political group).

"Nkabom" means united but we add "kuo" because it is an organisation. 
"Kuo" can be group, organisation or party(political group).

column1:
Imagine you're using an online marketplace like Alibaba or Jumia, buying and selling items from/to the Middle East, Asia, Europe, or elsewhere. You need to see the prices listed in local currencies all over the world, translated in your language. Please provide a translation of each of the currencies listed here. 

You're about to buy something from a seller in Kazakhstan, and the price-per-unit is "1 Kazakhstani tenge". How would you write "1 Kazakhstani tenge" in your language? What if the price-per-unit is "5 Kazakhstani tenges". How would you write "5 Kazakhstani tenges" in your language? 

Also, the ABBREVIATED word for "Kazakhstani tenge" is "KZT" and the SYMBOL for the currency is ₸. How would you write KZT and ₸ in your language? Would you change them? Or would they stay the same?

Imaginez que vous utilisez une plateforme de commerce électronique comme Alibaba ou Jumia, pour acheter ou vendre des articles au Moyen-Orient, en Asie, en Europe ou ailleurs. Vous devez voir les prix affichés dans les devises locales, traduits dans votre langue. Veuillez fournir une traduction de chacune des devises listées ici.

Vous êtes sur le point d’acheter quelque chose auprès d’un vendeur au Kazakhstan, et le prix unitaire est de « 1 tenge kazakhstanais ». Comment écririez-vous « 1 tenge kazakhstanais » dans votre langue ? Et si le prix unitaire était « 5 tenge kazakhstanais », comment l’écririez-vous ?

Aussi, l’abréviation du mot « tenge kazakhstanais » est « KZT » et le symbole de la devise est ₸. Comment écririez-vous « KZT » et « ₸ » dans votre langue ? Les modifieriez-vous ? Ou resteraient-ils les mêmes ?

column3: FOR REFERENCE ONLY (Where the Currency Comes From)

In this section, majority of the answers might be the same as the English version because majority of our language words were coined from the English language.
